Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Reverend Wendell Foster

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER FREED.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:  Reverend Wendell Foster

Council Member FREED moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

By Council Member Robles:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number C980640 PCK shall be subject to review by the Council.

By Council Member Linares:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number 990169MMM shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title:
By Council Members Leffler, Spigner and Watkins:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number 990451PPQ shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment of CHEREE A. BUGGS as a City Council appointment to the Equal Employment Practices Commission

REPORTS

Pursuant to Section 830 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules,  Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment of CHEREE A. BUGGS as a member of the Equal Employment Practices Commission, for a four year term which commenced on July 1, 1999 and will expire on June 30, 2003.

RES. NO. 1456

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE CITY COUNCIL OF CHEREE A. BUGGS TO THE EQUAL EMPLOYMENT PRACTICES COMMISSION

By Council Member Povman:

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Section 830 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections hereby approves the appointment of CHEREE A. BUGGS as a member of the Equal Employment Practices Commission, for a four year term which commenced on July 1, 1999 and will expire on June 30, 2003.
Items.MatterName: Equal Employment Practices Commission, Cheree A. Buggs

Section 202 of the Supportive Housing Programs for the Elderly, Troutman - Evergreen Senior Housing, 68-82 Troutman Street and 176-192 Evergreen Avenue, Brooklyn, Community District No. 4, Council District No. 34.
Communication from the City Council - Approving the appointment of a new Subcommittee Chairperson and allowance.

New Chairperson and allowance for Sub-Committee

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections respectfully

REPORTS

That it recommends favorable consideration by the Council of the following Sub-Committee Chairperson and allowance pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York.

Subcommittee on Abandonment, Foreclosure and Disinvestment
TRACY BOYLAND, Chairperson - $4,000

Res. No. 1455

Resolution approving the appointment of a new Sub-Committee Chairperson and allowance.

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York, the Council does hereby consent to the following Sub-Committee Chairperson and allowance.

Subcommittee on Abandonment, Foreclosure and Disinvestment
TRACY BOYLAND, Chairperson - $4,000

New Chairperson and allowance for Sub-Committee

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections respectfully

REPORTS

That it recommends favorable consideration by the Council of the following Sub-Committee Chairperson and allowance pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York.

Subcommittee on Abandonment, Foreclosure and Disinvestment
TRACY BOYLAND, Chairperson - $4,000

Res. No. 1455

Resolution approving the appointment of a new Sub-Committee Chairperson and allowance.

By Council Member Povman

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Rules 7.00 and 7.20 of the Council of the City of New York, the Council does hereby consent to the following Sub-Committee Chairperson and allowance.

Subcommittee on Abandonment, Foreclosure and Disinvestment
TRACY BOYLAND, Chairperson - $4,000

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the preparation of a comprehensive noise study prior to execution of any lease or other agreement relating to the use or operation of all or any portion of an airport owned by the city of New York.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the preparation of an air pollution study prior to execution of any lease or other agreement relating to the use or operation of all or any portion of an airport owned by the city of New York.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the preparation of a vehicular traffic study prior to execution of any lease or other agreement relating to the use or operation of all or any portion of an airport owned by the city of New York.
